title: Tony Davies
text:
William Anthony Davies (16 September 1939 – 6 April 2008) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer, who played 17 games for the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a> in 1960 and 1962 as a full-back or centre.
Davies was nominated for the All Blacks while playing for the <a href="University%20of%20Auckland">University of Auckland</a>'s rugby union team, and made his debut on 14 May 1960 in Sydney, Australia against <a href="Queensland%20Reds">Queensland</a>. His international debut was against <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa</a> on 27 August. He played 14 games for the All Blacks that year, then transferred to <a href="Dunedin">Dunedin</a> to study medicine, where he played 39 games for the <a href="University%20of%20Otago">University of Otago</a>. In 1962, Davies returned to the All Blacks for two games against <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a>, bringing his total national caps to 17.
Whilst furthering his medical studies in England, Davies played for <a href="Blackheath%20R.C.">Blackheath</a> (1971, 1972) and <a href="London%20Irish">London Irish</a> (1972–74).
Davies died in Sydney, Australia on 6 April 2008.
